div.p: This tag within WRITING TEXTUALFEATURES encloses a statement not about a writer’s technique generally but about specific tools, as listed in available attribute values. Applies to the structural components and devices of language used to create literary effects. It has no mandatory or optional sub-elements. One optional attribute, TECHNIQUETYPE, has values VERSIFICATION, NON-STANDARDENGLISH, DICTION, AURALEFFECTS, and IMAGERY. For a fuller discussion of these values, see TECHNIQUETYPE.

div.codeblock: <TTECHNIQUES TECHNIQUETYPE="VERSIFICATION”> Ann Grant's later work is written in stately couplets.</TTECHNIQUES> Elizabeth Pipe Wolferstan's genres and styles include epistles, <TTECHNIQUES TECHNIQUETYPE="DICTION”> imitations of Elizabethan language</TTECHNIQUES>, and sonnets.
